reviews.text: This is a great hotel in a convenient location! A few short steps and you are at Kings Cross/St. Pancras station. From Kings Cross, you can use the Underground to pretty much hit any section of London via the Tube. Eurostar is also located in this station. This was extremely convenient as we were going to ride the Eurostar to France after our stay in London. There are ATMs on the same street, a few fast food joints, convenience stores, groceries, etc. The British Library is also a short walk away. We stayed in Room 2, which is downstairs in Building 20 directly across the street. There is no lift, but this is nothing to complain about as the few steps are manageable. There is a computer with internet access in the reception area that guests can use, and free wi-fi is provided in the rooms. The room was a good size for London standards and at an unbeatable price - especially once you add their awesome breakfast! Their English breakfast consists of fried eggs, bacon, beans, sausage, tomato, toast, coffee, tea, juice, and many other choices. The breakfast staff was quick and efficient, always asking if we needed anything else. The hotel was great and the food was delicious, but the staff made the stay excellent! Bruno was very kind and extremely helpful with all our needs. Thank you to Alhambra Hotel and staff for a wonderful stay - we will definitely be back!
reviews.title: Excellent place and wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small, the bathroom is even smaller. Yes, there is no elevator. And yes, the hotel is not sound-proof. But if you need a place with good location, clean rooms, good breakfast and very helpful and friendly staff then this is your hotel. The King's Cross tube is just 200 metres away. The bus stop of #59 (to Waterloo bridge) and #10 (to Harrods) is 150 m. The train from Luton takes you to St. Pancras - that is also nearby. You can even walk to Regent's park or to Camden market, to Covent Garden and Soho. Highly recommended! My only complaint goes to the bed - the matresses were way too soft :(
reviews.title: Small but great

reviews.text: Excellent service, very good breakfast, small but extremely clean rooms. The staff made the stay. Would highly recommend. Less than 100 yards from tube and EuroStar train station. Room was inexpensive by London terms, and this as well as many hotels in the area are in modified townhomes, so expect size accordingy. It's away from the tourist area, but keep in mind the tube will take you almost anywhere in London. Also this was a single connection from Heathrow airport. So no worries about getting lost going from the Airport to the hotel
reviews.title: Review Alhambra Hotel Oct 2011

reviews.text: This hotel is a gem in central London. I was simply looking for an overnight stay near Kings Cross that was clean, well presented, and cheap (well... cheap in London terms!). I hit the jackpot with the Alhambra - it was everything I needed and was an excellent base for my recent trip to London.
reviews.title: Budget done extremely well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities in my en-suite room were very good. The room looked recently renovated so everything was in tip top condition. Particularly appreciated the super comfy double bed and great power shower. Overall I thought it had a similar feel to a good Traveloge room - basic, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: OMG.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my husband stayed overnight on a Saturday before an early morning Eurostar trip. The hotel was very convenient for St Pancras and there were lots of places locally to eat at. The room was clean and adequate, breakfast was excellent, and despite it being very busy nothing was too much trouble.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay

reviews.text: However it was a bit of a trek to the second floor with suitcases as the stair case was narrow and winding.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Convenient and comfortable
reviews.text: I'm so happy that I've found this hotel in London. I can gladly recommend it! We stayed in a triple and it was small but it got all we needed. Friendly staff and a tasty breakfast.

I stayed 15 nights at the Alhambra Hotel in late August/early September of 2011. It was comfortable, convenient, friendly, clean, and efficient. The room (one double bed) was small, but thoughtfully laid out. The fixtures and furniture (including a sink, LED light fixtures, and a wall-mounted flat panel TV) were modern and new, and the bed was comfortable. My room was on the third floor and the staircases are narrow. However, I had no difficulty getting up and down the stairs. The shared shower and the bathrooms are likewise snug, but clean and functional. Water pressure and hot water supply are both good.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was attentive, and the linens were of good quality. The English breakfast is also very, very good--good quality meat, and good service in a bright and cheerful basement dining room. I made my reservation online and paid with a credit card (3% surcharge, par for the course). All transactions were smooth and businesslike. The desk is staffed 24/7, but they give you a key to the outer door. I had only one request during my stay (resetting the room safe's combo), and it was taken care of immediately. The staff is friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful spot, so impressed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected Alhambra Hotel for its location and also based on other reviews and the hotel did not disappoint. Just around the corner from the Kings Cross station, we had access to several underground lines and were able to navigate the city really easily. The hotel itself was great. The room and bathroom were small (as we expected based on previous European hotel experiences) but very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating, providing us with a hairdryer and adapter for the length of our stay. The breakfast that is included was also really good. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the Alhambra Hotel and would definitely recommend it and would stay here again when we return to London.
reviews.title: Great location and value!

reviews.text: I'm staying at the Alhambra hotel for three nights and am finding it an excellent hotel. It has steep stairs so wouldn't suit those who don't can't manage stairs. I'm on the first floor with a window at the back of the building and slept with the window open and it wasn't noisy. There is no air conditioning and a fan would be nice, but since it is so quiet the open window suffices. The breakfast is fantastic, the staff warm and helpful and being opposite the Metro station is very handy.
reviews.title: Centrally located, great hosts, yummy breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Alhambra because it was reasonably priced and was only a few minutes walk to St Pancras station;perfect for our early morning Eurostar trip. Pros: The lady at the front desk was very helpful in helping us with some special requests we had. Rooms were clean and the breakfast was excellent. Located on a quiet side street close to some good pubs. Cons: Rooms are small, bathroom very cramped. Beds were pretty soft.
reviews.title: Decent enough for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was quite a pleasant surprise. I had checked reviews for this hotel on Trip Advisor and we decided to try it as we needed to stay in a hotel close to the Eurostar Terminal. The staff at the reception desk were extremely pleasant, the room was very clean and quite a wonderful value for the price. The breakfast was great and the breakfast room was very clean and the staff extremely efficient. It was a busy area being close to Euston Road, but being close to the terminal was wonderful.
reviews.title: Great location for St. Pancras/Kings Cross

reviews.text: I stayed two nights with my husband and my daughter two years. Staff were friendly and the breakfast was good. However I felt the room was too small and crammed. I had to drag my luggae and child four floors up and wasn't a great experience. However you couldn't find a better place than that just across the road from the kings cross underground and St. Pancras station. I consider coming back as long as I get a first floor room.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We've traveled to London for a business meeting and stayed in Alhambra Hotel for 4 nights. The hotel located at very busy location where you can reach King's Cross/St Pancras tube and train station in 2 minutes. Hotel is also very clean and the staff is very kind.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Location, very clean rooms, nice staff, good breakfast
reviews.title: What a find !

reviews.text: Pros: Sometimes the road can be very noisy, the rooms are small like the other hotels in central London.
reviews.title: Affordable hotel at great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Practical but not too quiet

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Alhambra for one night in early October.A terrific location close to Kings Cross and St.Pancras stations and being ideally situated just off busy Euston Road.The staff were extremely helpful and willing.We arrived early,as we were meeting family for a day out--reception staff very kindly let us leave our suitcases prior to our booking in.Many thanks! Our en suite room was immaculate--clean and tidy,with comfortable beds and a great shower.The full English breakfast the following morning was excellent as was the service.Your staff are a credit to you.We really cannot fault the Alhambra--we will not only use it again on our next visit to London,but will wholeheartedly recommend your hotel to anyone we hear visiting the capital.Our grateful thanks.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem
